LETHAL injection drugs could be used to save the lives of coronavirus patients who are on ventilators, docs say.
The drugs being requested include the sedative midazolam, the paralytic vecuronium bromide and the opioid fentanyl.
 Lethal injection drugs coul… [+2812 chars]

articles.title: Northern Ireland could face 'a cancer epidemic' as virus impacts vital patient care, says expert - Belfast Telegraph
articles.description: Northern Ireland could be facing a "cancer epidemic" as a legacy of the coronavirus pandemic, experts have warned.
articles.content:
Northern Ireland could be facing a "cancer epidemic" as a legacy of the coronavirus pandemic, experts have warned.
A Queen's University professor said many cases could be diagnosed at a later stage, making them more difficult to treat.

articles.author: Adam Chapman
articles.title: Coronavirus: A shocking new discovery may explain why Europe's death toll is so high - Express
articles.description: CORONAVIRUS has ravaged Europe and now the UK is expected to become the worst hit country. A new study proposes one scientific explanation for the assault on the continent.

articles.author: Lynn Love
articles.title: Tiny premature baby battles back from coronavirus to be discharged from hospital - Mirror Online
articles.description: Tina Peyton, who tested positive for the coronavirus just days after she was born via C-Section at University Hospital Wishaw in North Lanarkshire, is now free from the disease
articles.content:
The baby thought to be the youngest Covid-19 patient in Scotland has recovered from the disease.
Tiny Peyton was born eight weeks prematurely on March 26 and was delivered by C-Section after her mum Tracy Maguire was diagnosed with pre-eclampsia.
The young … [+2261 chars]

articles.title: Here are the similarities and differences between coronavirus and hay fever symptoms - ITV News
articles.description:
Hay fever sufferers have been told about the similarities and differences between hay fever and coronavirus symptoms by GPs.

NHS England guidelines say hay fever sufferers will typically start to experience a worsening of their symptoms from the end of March…

articles.title: The tiny premature baby who fought off coronavirus - BBC News
articles.description: Peyton Maguire from Lanarkshire is one of the youngest Covid-19 patients in the UK.
articles.content:

Tracy Maguire remembers the moment she saw doctors insert a swab into her three-week-old baby's nose to test for coronavirus.
